main_definition: A person regarded as a member of one's own group or community; also used informally to refer to someone in general.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An equal, peer, or companion within the same social circle or organization.
meanings_and_examples.example: After years working together at the charity, they considered each other good friends.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A term of address used for men in a friendly or respectful way, especially among equals.
meanings_and_examples.example: Good morning, fellow students! Are we all ready to start our lecture?

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to describe someone when one is trying not to be too formal but also wants to show some level of respect or politeness.
meanings_and_examples.example: She addressed the gentleman as 'Sir' in a polite manner, saying, 'Good afternoon, sir.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: An informal term used when referring to any man, especially without implying intimacy.
meanings_and_examples.example: I met my new neighbor; he seems like a good fellow.
